Show thinking

With the shaman and his shrine dealt with, only one path remains.

"Alright. Let's move to the chieftain's chamber," you declare, your voice firm.

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn hefts 'Ol Smashy and gives the prisoner a sharp tug on his ropes. "Finally! The big boss himself! Let's go finish this!" His eagerness for the final confrontation is palpable.

Anna (as Elara): Elara takes a deep, steadying breath, her hand resting on the Netherese Orb at her side. "This is it, then," she says, her voice low and serious. "Remember what we learned. Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter, and his ogre bodyguard, Gork. [from conversation] They will be together. This will be our most difficult fight yet. There is no room for error."

You lead the party out of the silent shrine, back across the corpse-strewn barracks, and towards the last, dark, unadorned tunnel. Bjorn shoves the whimpering orc prisoner ahead of you all as a reluctant point-man.

The passage is dark and slopes gently upwards. The air grows warmer, thick with the smell of unwashed bodies and cooked meat, and you can hear the faint, guttural rumble of a deep voice ahead. You have reached the entrance to the chieftain's personal chamber.

How do you wish to approach this final confrontation? Do you:

Scout ahead alone to see the layout of the room?

Attempt a stealthy approach with the entire party?

Send the prisoner in first to announce you?

Charge in, just as you did with the shaman?

Sources

Let's scout ahead

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Let's scout ahead," you decide, knowing you can't afford any more surprises.

Anna (as Elara): Elara gives you a grave look. "A wise decision, Lan. We must know what we face." She hesitates. "But remember, I have no magic left to make you invisible. You will be relying entirely on your own skill and the shadows. The risk is far greater this time."

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn nods, pulling the prisoner closer. "Right. You go do your deadly mouse thing one last time. We'll wait here with our... 'friend'." He glares at the orc. "Try not to take too long. My axe is ready for a real fight."

You give them a nod and turn to face the dark, upward-sloping passage. Taking a deep breath, you melt into the shadows, your steps becoming utterly silent as you creep towards the chieftain's chamber. The guttural voice you heard earlier is clearer now, speaking in Orcish.

This approach requires your utmost skill. This will be a difficult Dexterity (Stealth) check, with a DC of 17.

Rolling 1d20 + 5 for Lan's Stealth: The die is cast... a 14! Your result is 19!

A success! You move with the silence of a predator, using every bit of uneven rock and shadow for cover. You reach the end of the passage and find a concealed position behind a rock pillar, allowing you to peer into the chieftain's personal chamber.

The room is a large, natural cavern, dominated by a huge, smoky fire pit. The walls are adorned with crude trophies: dented shields, broken swords, and the skulls of various beasts and men. Against the far wall sits a massive, throne-like chair made of stone and the bones of some huge creature.

And in that chair sits the chieftain.

Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter: He is a massive orc, larger and more scarred than any you have seen before. He wears a patchwork of heavy hide and stolen plate mail. A huge, vicious-looking greataxe rests against his throne. He is not alone.

Gork the Ogre: Standing beside the throne like a living mountain is the second ogre. He is awake, alert, and armed with a massive club. His small, brutish eyes scan the room constantly.

The chieftain is currently examining a piece of parchment—a map. From your angle, you can just make out that it looks like a map of the local area around Phandalin.

You are hidden. You have successfully scouted the final encounter. You now know the layout and the enemy's disposition.

What is your next move?

They are massive. We can't afford any mistake. We'll have to formulate a plan.

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

You commit the scene to memory—the hulking chieftain on his throne, the alert ogre bodyguard, the layout of the room. This is the final challenge.

"They are massive," you think, your mind racing. "We can't afford any mistake. We'll have to formulate a plan."

Withdrawing from your vantage point with the same practiced silence that got you there, you slip back down the dark, sloping tunnel. You rejoin your companions, who look up with tense anticipation as you emerge from the shadows.

You quickly and quietly relay everything you saw: the massive Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter on his throne, the map he was studying, and his ever-watchful ogre bodyguard, Gork. You conclude your grim report with your assessment.

"They are massive," you whisper. "We can't afford any mistake. We'll have to formulate a plan."

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn listens intently, his knuckles white on the hilt of his greatsword. A slow, predatory grin spreads across his face. "So, the big boss and his even bigger pet. Finally! A real fight!" He looks from you to Elara, his eyes burning with eagerness. "Whatever the plan is, Lan, I'll take the big one. You two handle the chieftain."

Anna (as Elara): Elara absorbs your report with grave intensity, her brow furrowed in concentration. "A chieftain and his ogre bodyguard, both alert... this is the heart of their power," she murmurs. "You are right, Lan. A mistake here would be our last. We cannot fight them both head-on. The ogre's brute strength combined with the chieftain's martial skill would overwhelm us."

She meets your gaze, her mind already working through the tactical possibilities. "We must find a way to separate them, or incapacitate one while we eliminate the other."

The final challenge is laid bare. The party looks to you, their strategist, for the plan of attack. How do you propose to defeat the chieftain and his ogre bodyguard?

Let's eliminate the ogre first. You guys take on the ogre, i'll distract the chieftain.

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Let's eliminate the ogre first," you say, finalizing the strategy. "You guys take on the ogre, I'll distract the chieftain."

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn cracks his neck, a wide, fierce grin on his face. "Right! You keep the boss busy, Lan. Elara and I will turn this other big lug into a puddle! Leave Gork to Ol' Smashy!"  He readies his greatsword, his focus absolute.

Anna (as Elara): Elara gives a sharp, serious nod. "Focusing our fire on the ogre first is the correct tactical decision. Removing it from the battle quickly is paramount."  She then looks at you, a deep line of concern on her brow. "But Lan, you will be alone with the chieftain. Brughor is not a common warrior. Be incredibly careful. Use your speed. Do not let him corner you."

The terrified orc prisoner, hearing your plan, begins to shake uncontrollably. "You're mad... all mad... The Axe-Biter will chop you to bits..."

The plan is set. You are all poised at the entrance to the chieftain's chamber, ready to launch the final assault.

How do you initiate the attack, Lan? What is the signal?

Sources

Let's start with an ambush. I'll shoot the ogre with my masterwork arrow, and then try to distract the chieftain

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Let's start with an ambush," you whisper, the final plan set. "I'll shoot the ogre with my masterwork arrow, and then try to distract the chieftain."

Your companions give you a grim, final nod.

From the deep shadows of the tunnel entrance, you carefully nock one of the three sleek, black-feathered arrows. You take aim at the massive, brutish form of Gork, the ogre bodyguard, who is standing alert but unsuspecting by his master's throne. This shot has to be perfect.

You will make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to remain hidden as you take the shot.

Rolling 1d20 + 5 for Lan's Stealth: The roll is a 16. Your result is 21. You remain perfectly concealed.

You loose the arrow. It flies from the shadows, a silent, black streak.

Because you are hidden, your attack has advantage, and you get your Sneak Attack damage.

Attack Roll vs. Gork the Ogre (Advantage): Rolling... 17 and 9. You take the higher roll. Your attack is 17 + 5 (Dex+Prof) = 22! A clean HIT!

Damage (1d6 Bow + 3 Dex + 2d6 Sneak Attack): Rolling... 5 (bow) + 3 (Dex) + 10 (sneak) = 18 piercing damage!

The masterwork arrow sinks deep into the ogre's thick hide, embedding itself in its shoulder or back. Gork lets out a deafening bellow of pain and surprise, staggering forward and whirling around, trying to find his unseen attacker.

Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter leaps to his feet, his eyes flashing with fury as he sees the black-feathered arrow buried in his bodyguard. "AMBUSH!" he roars, grabbing his massive greataxe. "SHOW YOURSELVES, COWARDS!"

The ambush is successful! Your party gets a surprise round before regular combat begins.

Surprise Round!

You, Elara, and Bjorn all get to act before the enemy can react.

Lan, you have already taken your action by firing the arrow.

It is now Elara's turn in the surprise round. The wounded ogre is bellowing in pain, and the chieftain is scanning for threats. What does she do?

Elara RP as herself

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

Anna (as Elara):

Seeing your masterwork arrow find its mark, Elara immediately acts to press the advantage, following the plan precisely. She steps to the edge of the tunnel's shadows, her eyes locked on the wounded, roaring ogre.

"The beast first!" she cries out, her voice sharp and commanding.

As an Evocation wizard, her specialty is raw offensive power.  She raises a hand, and a bead of intense flame gathers at her fingertips. She unleashes her most reliable cantrip, Fire Bolt.

Spell Attack Roll (1d20 + 6): The roll is a 15. With her +6 bonus for Evocation spells (+3 Int, +2 Prof, +1 from the Netherese Orb), her attack is a 21!  This is a solid HIT against the ogre's AC.

Damage (1d10 fire damage): The roll is a 9!

The bolt of fire streaks across the throne room and slams into the ogre's side, causing it to roar even louder in pain and fury as its flesh is seared. It is now very heavily wounded from the combined attacks.

That concludes Elara's turn in the surprise round. The ogre is still standing, but reeling.

Bjorn, you are next. The path is clear for you to charge. What do you do?

Sources

Action surge! Strike the ogre twice

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

Bam (as Bjorn): Seeing the massive ogre reeling but still on its feet, Bjorn refuses to give it a moment to recover. His eyes burn with furious intensity.

"Not... enough!" he roars, a deep well of adrenaline surging through him. "Action Surge!"

He uses his fighter's training to push past his limits, readying himself for another immediate attack. He had charged across the room, and now he unleashes the full might of his assault.

First Attack: Bjorn swings 'Ol Smashy in a wide, brutal arc at the wounded ogre.

Attack Roll (1d20 + 6): Rolling... 17! That's a 23 to hit! A powerful HIT!

Damage (2d6 + 4): Rolling... 5 + 5 = 10. That's 14 slashing damage!

The greatsword bites deep into the ogre's leg, and the beast bellows in agony, its knee buckling.

Second Attack (from Action Surge): Without pausing, Bjorn brings the massive sword around for a second strike.

Attack Roll (1d20 + 6): Rolling... 19! That's a 25 to hit! Another clean HIT!

Damage (2d6 + 4): Rolling... 6 + 4 = 10. That's another 14 slashing damage!

The second blow slams into the ogre's side. Gork staggers, roaring in defiance, blood pouring from multiple grievous wounds. It is incredibly battered and on the very brink of death, but through sheer brute toughness, it is still standing.

The Surprise Round is now over. Regular combat begins. Let's establish the initiative order for the battle ahead.

Bjorn: 20

Lan (You): 15

Chieftain Brughor: 13

Elara: 10

Gork the Ogre: 6

Round 1 begins!

It is Bjorn's turn again at the top of the order. The critically wounded ogre is right in front of him. Chieftain Brughor is across the room by his throne, axe in hand, ready to act.

What does Bjorn do?

Sources

OOC: Wait, shouldn't our prisoner orc also join the battle?

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

OOC: That's a very good point. You are right, he is in the room.

When Bjorn charged in, he shoved the prisoner into the room ahead of him. The terrified, bound orc likely stumbled and fell into a corner, and is now cowering and trying to make himself as small as possible.

Because he is bound, gagged, and has no weapons, he can't take any actions to help in the fight. For now, he is effectively a non-combatant, so we haven't added him to the initiative order. However, he is present in the room and could potentially become a target for the chieftain or the ogre.

We can proceed with Bjorn's turn at the top of the round.

Alright. Bjorn strike the ogre again

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

It is Bjorn's turn at the top of the round. The massive ogre, Gork, is staggering before him, barely alive.

Bam (as Bjorn): "Still standing?" Bjorn pants, sweat beading on his brow. "Not for long!"

He raises 'Ol Smashy one more time, determined to finish the job before the beast can swing its club. He brings the greatsword down in a final, decisive blow.

Attack Roll (1d20 + 6): Rolling... a 12! His attack is 18! That's another clean HIT!

Damage (2d6 + 4): Rolling... 3 + 4 = 7. That's 11 slashing damage!

The greatsword bites deep into the ogre's chest. It is more than the battered creature can withstand. Gork gives a final, shuddering gasp, its eyes rolling back in its head. The massive club slips from its grasp and clatters to the floor. The ogre then collapses, shaking the very stones of the cavern as it hits the ground, dead.

Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter watches his bodyguard fall. A look of disbelief, quickly replaced by pure, unrestrained fury, contorts his scarred face.

"GOOORK!" he bellows, his voice a raw explosion of rage. He turns his burning eyes from the dead ogre to you and Bjorn. "I will wear your skulls as drinking cups!"

That concludes Bjorn's turn. The ogre is down. The enraged chieftain is the only enemy left.

It is now your turn, Lan (Initiative 15). Brughor is across the room by his throne, brandishing his greataxe.

What do you do?

Sources

Not feeling so tough without your bodyguard, huh?

I then spread a bag of caltrops below his feet

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Not feeling so tough without your bodyguard, huh?" you shout across the room, your voice sharp and mocking.

While the enraged Chieftain Brughor is focused on Bjorn, you reach into your pack, pull out one of your remaining bags of caltrops, and with a deft flick of your wrist, send the sharp metal spikes scattering across the floor directly in front of his throne.

The caltrops clatter on the stone, covering a 5-foot square area right where he would need to step to charge forward.

Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter: The chieftain's head snaps toward you, his eyes burning with fury at your taunt. "I'll show you tough, little man!" he snarls, his knuckles white on the haft of his greataxe. He glances down at the caltrops at his feet, then back at you, a look of utter contempt on his face.

That completes your turn. You've successfully deployed a hazardous obstacle at the chieftain's feet.

It is now Chieftain Brughor's turn (Initiative 13). He is enraged, his bodyguard is dead, and you have just thrown a handful of sharp metal spikes at him.

What does he do?

Sources

Roleplay as himself. Uses every arsenal in his official skillset in order to win

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

It is the Chieftain's turn.

Brughor Axe-Biter lets out a guttural roar that is pure rage. He points his massive greataxe at you, Lan. "I will silence your mocking tongue myself, whelp!"

Ignoring the caltrops for a moment, he decides to use his authority as a leader.

Bonus Action: Brughor unleashes his Battle Cry. "For the Eye! For Brughor! Kill them all!" he bellows. But his shaman is dead, his ogre is dead, and his warriors are either in a pit or captured. The fearsome cry echoes uselessly in the chamber, finding no allies to empower. His face twists in renewed fury at the silence.

Movement & Action: Spitting on the caltrops at his feet, he decides to endure them rather than slow down. He charges straight through them towards Bjorn, the most immediate threat.

Caltrops DC 15 Dexterity Save: Rolling... 4! He fails the saving throw.

A spike digs deep into his boot. He takes 1 piercing damage and his speed is reduced by 10 feet.

He snarls in pain and annoyance but is undeterred. The reduced speed still allows him to reach Bjorn. Now in melee range, he uses his Multiattack feature, swinging his huge, jagged greataxe twice with ferocious speed.

First Attack vs. Bjorn:

Attack Roll (1d20 + 5): Rolling... 19! That's a 24 to hit! A crushing HIT!

Damage (1d12 + 3 slashing): Rolling... 10! That's 13 slashing damage! The axe slams into Bjorn's shield and armor with brutal force, staggering him.

Second Attack vs. Bjorn:

Attack Roll (1d20 + 5): Rolling... 9! That's a 14 to hit. The chieftain's rage makes his second swing sloppy, and it glances off Bjorn's armor. A MISS!

That concludes the chieftain's turn. He has closed the distance, endured the caltrops, and landed a heavy blow on Bjorn.

It is now Elara's turn (Initiative 10). The enraged chieftain is locked in combat with Bjorn.

What does Elara do?

Roleplay as herself

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

Anna (as Elara):

Seeing Bjorn take a vicious blow from the chieftain's axe, Elara immediately retaliates from her position at the entrance of the chamber. Her cautious nature dictates that she engage this powerful foe from a safe distance.

"Your reign ends now, Axe-Biter!" she calls out, her voice ringing with arcane power.

She extends a hand, and a bolt of brilliant flame erupts from her palm, streaking across the room directly at the chieftain. She attacks with her Fire Bolt cantrip, empowered by her Netherese Orb.

Spell Attack Roll (1d20 + 6): Rolling... 12! Her attack is 18! This strikes true against the chieftain's armor. A HIT!

Damage (1d10 fire damage): Rolling... 8! The chieftain takes 8 fire damage.

The bolt of fire slams into Brughor's chest, causing him to roar in pain and anger. He stumbles back a step, his patchwork armor singed and smoking. He glares at Elara with pure hatred, now aware of the multiple threats he faces.

That concludes Elara's turn.

The round has reset. It is now Bjorn's turn again at the top of the order. The enraged Chieftain Brughor is wounded and still locked in melee with him.

What does Bjorn do?

Sources

Bjorn RP as himself

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

Bam (as Bjorn):

Bjorn grunts as the chieftain's axe bites into his armor, but his response is a wide, ferocious grin. He stands his ground, unflinching, his loyalty to his friends fueling his fury.

"My turn again, Axe-Biter!" he bellows, his voice booming in the cavern. "You hit hard, but Ol' Smashy hits harder!"

He swings his greatsword in a powerful, cleaving arc, putting all of his formidable strength into the blow.

Attack Roll (1d20 + 6): Rolling... a 14! His attack is 20! That's a solid HIT!

Damage (2d6 + 4): Rolling the dice... a 1 and a 5.

Because of his Great Weapon Fighting style, Bjorn can re-roll any 1s or 2s on his damage dice. He re-rolls the 1... and gets a 4!

His final damage is (4 + 5) + 4 (Str) = 13 slashing damage!

'Ol Smashy crashes into the chieftain's side, carving another deep wound. Brughor stumbles, roaring in pain. He is now severely wounded from the party's relentless, focused assault.

That concludes Bjorn's turn.

It is now your turn, Lan (Initiative 15). The enraged and badly wounded Chieftain Brughor is locked in melee with Bjorn.

What do you do?

While Chieftain Brughor is reeling from Bjorn's powerful blow, you see your opening. With Bjorn holding the chieftain's attention, you dart in, your rapier a silver blur aiming for a gap in his patchwork armor.

You stab him with your rapier. Because Bjorn is engaging the chieftain, you are able to land a devastating Sneak Attack for 2d6 damage.

Attack Roll (1d20 + 5): Rolling... 15! Your attack is 20! A clean HIT!

Damage (1d8 Rapier + 3 Dex + 2d6 Sneak Attack):

Rapier (1d8): 6

Sneak Attack (2d6): 5 + 4 = 9

Your total damage is 6 + 9 + 3 (your Dexterity modifier ) = 18 piercing damage!

Your blade sinks deep into the chieftain's side. He lets out a guttural scream of pure agony, stumbling away from Bjorn and clutching the new wound. He is grievously injured and barely able to stand, his rage now mingled with shock and pain.

That concludes your turn.

It is now Chieftain Brughor's turn (Initiative 13). He is on the verge of death, surrounded by the three adventurers who have systematically dismantled his entire war band.

What does the chieftain do?

Sources

OOC: Will the chieftain plead for his life, or continue fighting? He knows that we are far superior to him

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

OOC: That's an excellent question that gets to the heart of his character.

Given what you know, Brughor Axe-Biter will continue fighting to the death.

Here's why, based on the clues you've gathered:

His Pride as Chieftain: He is the leader of the tribe. To be brought so low and then beg for his life would be the ultimate humiliation, something his pride would not allow.

His Faith: Elara identified the "Bleeding Eye" symbol as that of Gruumsh, the primary orc deity. Gruumsh is a god of war, conquest, and strength. His followers believe that dying in battle is an honorable fate, while cowardice and pleading for mercy are the greatest sins. For a chieftain to beg would be to betray his god.

His Actions So Far: His reactions have been pure rage and defiance, not fear. He roared at you, taunted you, and charged through the caltrops rather than be delayed.

While his underlings might plead for their lives, a chieftain like Brughor would rather try to take one of you with him in a final, bloody act of defiance than suffer the dishonor of surrender. He will fight to his last breath.

Sources

Okay. RP as himself

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

It is the chieftain's turn.

Brughor Axe-Biter, bleeding from half a dozen wounds and barely able to stand, lets out a final, defiant death roar. He knows he is finished, but his pride as a chieftain of Gruumsh demands he take an enemy with him.

He ignores the massive threat of Bjorn for a moment and turns his full, burning hatred on you, Lan—the one who taunted him and delivered the most recent gutting wound.

"DIE, WHELP!" he screams, blood flying from his lips.

He uses his Multiattack, swinging his massive, jagged greataxe at you twice in a final, desperate flurry.

First Attack vs. Lan:

Attack Roll (1d20 + 5): Rolling... 18! That's a 23 to hit! It's a brutal, solid HIT!

Damage (1d12 + 3 slashing): Rolling... 9! You take 12 slashing damage!

The axe slams into you with incredible force, a punishing blow that sends a shock of agony through your body and nearly knocks you off your feet.

Second Attack vs. Lan:

Attack Roll (1d20 + 5): Rolling... 7! That's a 12 to hit. In his wounded state, the chieftain's second swing is wild and clumsy, missing you entirely.

Having spent his last ounce of strength, Brughor staggers, his greataxe feeling heavy in his hands. His turn is over.

It is now Elara's turn (Initiative 10). The chieftain is on his last legs, having just landed a heavy blow on you.

What does Elara do?

Elara roleplay as herself

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

Anna (as Elara):

Elara winces as she sees the chieftain's axe slam into you, Lan. Her tactical focus instantly sharpens into cold, protective fury. She cannot risk a spell that might miss. The threat to her friends must end, now.

"This ends now," she declares, her voice cutting through the sounds of battle.

She expends her final remaining 1st-level spell slot, casting the one spell that cannot fail: Magic Missile.

Three glowing darts of pure arcane force spring from her outstretched hand. They do not fly in a straight line but weave through the air, unerringly homing in on the staggered Chieftain Brughor.

Dart 1 Damage (1d4+1): Rolling... 3 + 1 = 4 force damage.

Dart 2 Damage (1d4+1): Rolling... 2 + 1 = 3 force damage.

Dart 3 Damage (1d4+1): Rolling... 4 + 1 = 5 force damage.

The chieftain has no defense. The three bolts of force strike him one after another—thump, thump, thump—each one a concussive, inevitable blow.

Brughor Axe-Biter's eyes go wide, the last of his rage and life extinguished by the relentless magical assault. The massive greataxe slips from his grasp and clatters onto the stone floor. He stands motionless for a heartbeat, then topples backward, crashing lifelessly at the foot of his own bone throne.

Silence, final and absolute, descends upon the chieftain's chamber.

The battle is over. You are victorious.

You, Lan, are wounded. Bjorn stands panting over the body of the chieftain. The prisoner is still cowering by the entrance. The leaders of the Wyvern Tor orcs are dead.

What do you do?

There's that, ughh, this hurts

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"There's that," you say, letting out a ragged breath as you clutch your side where the chieftain's axe struck you. "Ughh, this hurts."

The adrenaline from the desperate battle begins to fade, replaced by the sharp, throbbing pain of your wound.

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn lets out a massive, booming laugh that echoes through the now-silent chamber. He kicks the chieftain's fallen axe. "Hurts? Of course, it hurts! But look at 'em, Lan! We did it! We smashed the whole lot of 'em!" He stomps over and claps you on the back, a little too hard, his face beaming with pride and relief. "You took a nasty hit, but you're standing! That's what matters!"

Anna (as Elara): Elara approaches, her own relief visible but tempered with her usual pragmatism. She looks at your wound with concern. "That was a formidable blow. You are bleeding freely." She then looks around the room, at the bodies of the chieftain and his ogre bodyguard. "But the threat is over. We have triumphed."

She turns her attention back to you. "We must tend to that wound, Lan. We cannot risk infection or weakness. Do you wish to use a potion?" She is referring to the Potions of Healing you received from Sister Garaele.

The room is quiet now, save for your own breathing and the pathetic whimpering of the orc prisoner still cowering by the entrance. The leaders of the Wyvern Tor tribe lie dead at your feet. You are victorious, but not unscathed.

What do you do?

Show thinking

"Sure," you grunt, pressing a hand against the painful wound on your side. "It looks like it will take a while to arrive at Phandalin."

Anna (as Elara): Elara nods, her expression softening with relief. "It is for moments precisely like this that we have them. Drink."

You pull one of the three Potions of Healing you received from Sister Garaele from your pack. You uncork the vial and quickly down the shimmering, red liquid. A magical warmth spreads through your chest, and the sharp, throbbing pain in your side lessens to a dull, manageable ache.

Potion of Healing: Rolling 2d4+2... You regain 7 hit points.

Bam (as Bjorn): "Aye, down the hatch!" Bjorn says with a nod of approval. "No point saving 'em if you're bleeding all over the floor!" He then gestures with his axe towards the fallen chieftain. "Now that you're not about to fall over, shall we see if the big boss had anything worth taking?"

With your immediate wound tended to, the chamber is quiet once more, save for the crackling fire and the prisoner's whimpering. The bodies of Chieftain Brughor Axe-Biter and his ogre bodyguard, Gork, lie motionless before you.

What do you do now?

Sources

Right. Let's go looting! Bjorn, would you like to take the chief's axe?

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Right. Let's go looting!" you declare, the immediate danger having passed. You look over at the massive greataxe lying on the floor beside the dead chieftain. "Bjorn, would you like to take the chief's axe?"

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn's eyes light up. He stomps over and hefts the chieftain's greataxe, testing its weight. It's a huge, brutal-looking weapon, adorned with crude etchings and notches for every kill. He gives it a few practice swings. "Hah, it's a hefty chopper, alright! Mean-lookin' thing."

He then looks over at his own greatsword, 'Ol Smashy', which is propped against the nearby throne. A look of genuine affection crosses his face. "Nah," he decides, setting the chieftain's axe back down. "This one's got no soul. I'll stick with Ol' Smashy. She's never let me down."  His loyalty to his own weapon is unshakable.

While Bjorn makes his decision, you and Elara begin to search the chieftain's body and the area around his bone throne.

On Chieftain Brughor's Body: He wears a surprisingly well-made chain mail shirt under his hide armor. In a pouch at his belt, you find 30 gp, 55 sp, and a small, uncut piece of obsidian. He also wears a heavy iron ring set with a single, jagged piece of red stone, which feels faintly magical to the touch.

The Throne & Surroundings: Tucked behind the bone throne is a heavy, unlocked chest. Inside, you find several fine furs, a silver drinking horn decorated with images of wolves, and at the bottom, a rolled-up piece of parchment. Upon unrolling it, you see it is a letter. The handwriting is neat and precise, a stark contrast to the crude orcish items around it. It is signed with a symbol you've seen before in Glasstaff's notes: a black spider.

Anna (as Elara): Elara takes the letter, her eyes scanning the text quickly. "Lan, you need to see this," she says, her voice grave. "It's from the Black Spider... a direct order to Brughor. It seems the chieftain was paid to capture 'the dwarves'—plural—and seize their map. It mentions that the Black Spider's 'agents' will handle the prisoner from there and that Brughor's tribe will be rewarded once Wave Echo Cave is 'secured'."

The letter confirms it: this entire operation was orchestrated by the Black Spider.

You have now defeated all the leaders of this orc encampment. You have a bound prisoner, a wealth of new loot and intelligence, and a direct link to your primary foe. The chieftain's chamber is cleared.

What is your next move?

Of course. It is vital to have a clear account of your resources. Here is a detailed, updated list of the party's items, equipment, and money, reflecting everything you had at the start of our session and all the changes that have occurred during your assault on Wyvern Tor.

Updated Party Inventory & Treasury

Lan (You)

Armor: Leather Armor

Weapons:

Rapier

Shortbow  (approximately 25 arrows remaining)

2 masterwork black-feathered arrows (one was used to attack the ogre, Gork).

Adventuring Gear:

Thieves' Tools

Climber's Kit

Grappling Hook

Healer's Kit (Depleted; the last use was expended on your javelin wound).

3 bags of Caltrops (one bag was used outside the cave).

Other Notable Items:

Silver Locket (with a portrait of a sad woman)

Silver Locket (plainer, containing the Teleportation Key Sigil)

A small, unidentified silver amulet (acquired from a chest).

A heavy, crude iron key (stolen from the ogre Gragnok).

Elara Meadowlight

Weapons: Quarterstaff (as her Staff of Defense).

Adventuring Gear: Spellbook (containing all known spells), Component Pouch, 5 sheets of Parchment, Jar of Powdered Silver.

Magical Items:

Staff of Defense (attuned)

Netherese Orb (attuned)

Wand of Magic Detection

Ring of Animal Influence (holding, not attuned)

Other Notable Items: Hamun Kost's Spellbook, Scroll: Darkness.

Bjorn Stonehand

Armor: Chain Mail, Shield

Weapons:

Greatsword ("Ol' Smashy")

Handaxes (one was thrown and has not yet been retrieved).

Adventuring Gear: Waterskin, Whetstone, Gundren's Mining Pick (retrieved from the ogre cage).

Other Notable Items: 2 Jade Frog Statuettes.

Unassigned Party Loot (Acquired at Wyvern Tor)

From the Orcs: Bone Signal Whistle, a crude map on hide, a necklace of yellowed animal teeth, a polished orc tooth on a leather thong.

From the Shaman's Shrine: A small iron key, a potion vial with a bubbling dark purple liquid, a wooden totem of a bleeding eye, bundles of herbs (Wolfsbane, Nightshade), and a block of incense.

From the Chieftain's Room:

A well-made Chain Mail shirt.

A heavy iron ring set with a single, jagged red stone (faintly magical).

A silver drinking horn decorated with images of wolves.

A small, uncut piece of obsidian.

A letter signed with a black spider symbol.

Updated Party Treasury

Your treasury has grown significantly after looting the storeroom chest and the bodies of the slain orcs.

Gold Pieces (gp): 179

Silver Pieces (sp): 372

Electrum Pieces (ep): 35

Copper Pieces (cp): 701

Show thinking

"I see. Well, we have come here to do what we gotta do," you say, looking around at the silent, defeated throne room. "Let's return and report to Phandalin."

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn slams a fist into his palm in satisfaction. "Aye! Good riddance to the Axe-Biter! We came, we saw, and we did a whole lot of smashing!" He grins, "And a reward in Phandalin sounds good to me. My throat's as dry as a desert!"

Anna (as Elara): Elara nods, her expression one of weary relief. "A sound decision, Lan. We have neutralized the immediate threat to the region as requested, and we've uncovered vital intelligence about the Black Spider's operations.  Returning to a secure location like Phandalin to rest, heal, and plan our next move against Cragmaw Castle is the most prudent course of action."

She then glances towards the passage where you left your prisoner. "There is one last matter to attend to before we depart. Our... ally."

The bound and gagged orc prisoner remains under Bjorn's guard. You must decide his fate before you leave Wyvern Tor. Do you:

Release him, as you did the other orc, and warn him never to return?

Take him with you on the long journey back to Phandalin to be handed over to the authorities?

Execute him, ensuring he can never be a threat or report your numbers to other orcs?

What is your final decision regarding the prisoner?

Sources

Just release him, and have him spread the word that the orc will no longer bother humans of this region.

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Just release him," you decide, your voice carrying a tone of finality. "And have him spread the word that the orcs will no longer bother humans of this region."

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn grunts, surprised but accepting. "Another one? You're gettin' soft, Lan." A slow grin spreads across his face. "But I like it. Let him run. Let 'em all know who cleared out this sty." He cuts the orc's bonds with his dagger and shoves him forward.

Anna (as Elara): Elara watches with a thoughtful expression. "A messenger. You turn a loose end into an instrument of peace for the region. Clever."

You step forward and look the terrified, newly-freed orc in the eye. "Go. Tell whatever is left of your kind that Wyvern Tor is finished. Tell them the Axe-Biter is dead. This land is under our protection now. If we see you again, you will not be so lucky."

The orc, not believing his fortune, scrambles to his feet and flees without a backward glance, disappearing into the wilderness.

With your work at Wyvern Tor complete, you gather your new treasures and begin the long journey back to Phandalin. The trip is arduous but uneventful. After a few days of travel, the familiar sight of the town comes as a welcome relief.

You arrive back in Phandalin late in the afternoon. The town is bustling, and the atmosphere is significantly more relaxed and cheerful than when you first arrived, a direct result of your previous deeds in removing the Redbrand menace.  The townsfolk nod to you with respect as you walk down the main street.

You have a wealth of new information for Sildar Hallwinter about Gundren and the Black Spider, a pouch full of coin, and a need for rest and resupply.

Where do you head first?

Sources

Right. First things first, let's head out to the inn. I am still feeling a little sore from that orc,

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"Right. First things first, let's head out to the inn," you say, rolling a shoulder that still aches from the chieftain's blow. "I am still feeling a little sore from that orc."

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn's face breaks into a wide grin. "The inn! Now you're speakin' my language, Lan! A hot meal, a cold ale... or ten! My throat's as dry as that cave was."

Anna (as Elara): Elara gives a weary but content smile. "An excellent decision. The Stonehill Inn will provide a secure and comfortable place for us to properly rest, tend to our wounds, and discuss the intelligence we've gathered before we report to Sildar. A clear head is as vital as a sharp blade."

The three of you make your way through the bustling streets of Phandalin to the familiar sight of the Stonehill Inn. As you push open the door, a wave of warmth, savory smells, and cheerful noise washes over you. The common room is lively, a testament to the peace you helped bring to the town.

Toblen Stonehill, the innkeeper, spots you from behind the bar. A wide, genuine smile lights up his face.

"Our heroes return!" he calls out, his voice full of warmth. "And covered in glory and grime, by the looks of it! Welcome, welcome! Rooms for the night? A round of my best ale to celebrate your safe return?"

He gestures to an empty table near the fire, the best spot in the house. The other patrons in the inn murmur their approval and raise their mugs to you. You have certainly earned a reputation here.

We had a rough adventure, but all is worth it. The orc of wyvern tor is no more. Toblen, i would like full breakfast menu in this evening please

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

"We had a rough adventure, but all is worth it. The orcs of Wyvern Tor are no more," you announce, weariness evident in your voice but pride in your words. You manage a tired smile for the innkeeper. "Toblen, I would like a full breakfast menu this evening, please."

Toblen's jaw drops for a second at the news, then he breaks into an even wider grin, grabbing the bar top with both hands. "No more? You've dealt with the whole tribe at Wyvern Tor?!" He lets out a hearty laugh. "By the gods, you three are more than heroes; you're a force of nature! This calls for a celebration!"

He winks at your unusual request. "A full breakfast for dinner it is! The biggest this inn can make! On the house, for the Protectors of Phandalin!" The entire common room erupts in a cheer at this.

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn slides into a chair at the table, letting 'Ol Smashy lean against the wall with a heavy thud. He sighs contentedly. "Hah! Breakfast for dinner! Now that's the kind of thinkin' I can get behind!" He eagerly accepts the tankard of ale Toblen brings over. "To smashing!" he toasts, taking a long, deep swallow.

Anna (as Elara): Elara takes a seat more gracefully, a rare, genuinely relaxed smile on her face. The warmth of the inn and the cheerful reception seem to melt some of her usual guardedness. "It is good to be back," she says quietly, more to herself than anyone else. "A hot meal that I did not have to cook over a campfire will be most welcome."

True to his word, Toblen soon brings out massive platters laden with sizzling bacon, eggs, fried potatoes, sausages, and fresh bread. It's a feast fit for heroes, and the party enjoys a well-deserved meal in the safety and comfort of the Stonehill Inn, the perils of Wyvern Tor feeling a world away.

You are all settled in, eating, drinking, and soaking in the atmosphere of a town that sees you as its saviors. What do you do or discuss now?

Enjoy the food, and have a banter with beer with the others

D

DnD

Custom Gem

Show thinking

You lean back in your chair, the warmth of the fire and the hearty food chasing away the chill of the Wyvern Tor caves. You take a long drink of ale, letting the day's tension finally begin to melt away.

Bam (as Bjorn): Bjorn, already halfway through his massive platter, raises his tankard high. "Hah! This is the life, my friends! Good food, good ale, and good company!" He lets out a booming laugh. "And to think, this morning we were wading through dead orcs! I'd say this is a fair trade!" He winks. "So, Lan, which was more satisfying? The look on that shaman's face, or the sound that ogre made when it hit the floor?"

Anna (as Elara): Elara takes a more delicate sip of her own ale, a small, amused smile playing on her lips. "I, for one, am simply pleased that the structural integrity of the cavern did not fail." She looks at you both over her mug. "Though, I must concede, your combined assault on the chieftain and his bodyguard was brutally effective. Your plan to separate them worked flawlessly, Lan. And Bjorn... your use of Action Surge was... decisive."  She gives him a nod of genuine respect.

Bam (as Bjorn): "Decisive? Hah! That's a fancy word for 'smashing'!"  he says proudly. "And what about you, Elara? That Magic Missile to save Lan from the wolf was quicker than a striking snake!  And zapping that last orc with the fire! You're getting good at this messy adventuring business!"

Anna (as Elara): "One adapts," she says with a slight shrug, though she looks pleased by the compliment. "A necessary application of Evocation principles. It is gratifying to see theory put into effective practice."

The three of you continue to eat and drink, the easy banter a welcome comfort after the life-or-death struggles you just endured. The weight of your adventure lifts for a moment, replaced by the simple pleasure of friendship and a shared victory.
